contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Person |name = Jonathan Lebed |image = |caption = |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|9|29}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |other_names = |known_for = |occupation = |nationality = [[United States]] }} '''Jonathan Lebed''' (born September 29, 1984) is an American notorious for using internet technology to hype stocks. Between September 1999 and February 2000 Lebed made hundreds of thousands of dollars by posting in internet chat rooms and on message boards encouraging people to buy [[penny stock]]s he already owned, thus, according to the [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission|SEC]], artificially raising the price of the stock. The SEC under [[Arthur Levitt]] prosecuted him. In 2001 Lebed and the SEC negotiated an out-of-court settlement in which Lebed forfeited $285,000 in profit and interest he had made on 11 trades without admitting any wrongdoing — allowing him to keep close to half a million dollars. The case was controversial — the SEC had never prosecuted a minor — and produced significant media interest. Lebed contended that his activity forecasting stock prices was no different from and no more illegal than what professional [[Wall Street]] analysts do every day, only he utilized the internet. Despite the negative press and SEC inquiry, Lebed continues to trade actively and sends out a free email newsletter on a daily basis in which he gives stock picks. The end of the newsletter often contains a disclaimer like the one below. <blockquote> '''My firm Lebed Biz LLC has been compensated by a third-party (<would be company name>) $20,000 cash for a one-month IDOI investor relations contract. Never invest into a stock we discuss unless you can afford to lose your entire investment. For our full disclaimer go to: www.lebed.biz/disclaimer.htm''' <br /><br /> '''Jonathan Lebed''' <br /> '''Lebed.biz''' <br /> '''Staff''' </blockquote> Lebed was profiled in an episode of the 2001 [[BBC]] [[futurism]] documentary ''The Future Just Happened''.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/hi/english/static/in_depth/programmes/2001/future/tv_series_1.stm ''The Future Just Happened'']</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *{{Citation |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2001/02/25/magazine/25STOCK-TRADER.html?pagewanted=all |title=Jonathan Lebed: Stock Manipulator, S.E.C. Nemesis -- and 15 |last=Lewis |first=Michael |date=February 25, 2001 |newspaper=New York Times}} ==External links== * [http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2000/10/19/60minutes/main242489.shtml CBS News, "Pump and Dump"] * [http://www.sec.gov/litigation/admin/33-7891.htm S.E.C. Desist order September 20, 2000] * [http://www.sec.gov/news/press/2000-135.txt S.E.C. Press release September 20, 2000] * [http://lebed.biz/ Jonathan Lebed's website] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Lebed, Jonathan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = September 29, 1984 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lebed, Jonathan}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American stock traders]]
